claim.body:
an arrow in a quiver comprising: providing an arrow securing device including: a cord having a first end, a longitudinal section, and a second end; at least one nock coupling end proximate at least one of the first end and the second end; and an anchor point selected from the group consisting of an anchor member and a locking mechanism, the anchor point being operatively coupled to the cord and adapted to couple the cord to a portion of a quiver;
securing the anchor point to the portion of the quiver by passing a portion of the cord through the nock; and attaching the at least one nock coupling end to a nock of an arrow in the quiver.
claim.claim-text:
1. A method of securing an arrow in a quiver comprising: providing an arrow securing device including: a cord having a first end, a longitudinal section, and a second end; at least one nock coupling end proximate at least one of the first end and the second end; and an anchor point selected from the group consisting of an anchor member and a locking mechanism, the anchor point being operatively coupled to the cord and adapted to couple the cord to a portion of a quiver;
securing the anchor point to the portion of the quiver by passing a portion of the cord through the nock; and attaching the at least one nock coupling end to a nock of an arrow in the quiver.

claim.body: securing the anchor point to the portion of the quiver comprises passing the cord through a hole in a gripper assembly coupled to the quiver.
claim.claim-text: 2. The method recited in claim 1 , wherein said securing the anchor point to the portion of the quiver comprises passing the cord through a hole in a gripper assembly coupled to the quiver.

claim.body: securing the anchor point to the portion of the quiver comprises securing the anchor point to a body section of the quiver.
claim.claim-text: 3. The method recited in claim 1 , wherein said securing the anchor point to the portion of the quiver comprises securing the anchor point to a body section of the quiver.

claim.body: the at least one nock coupling end includes a tab member disposed proximate either or both of the first end and the second end.
claim.claim-text: 4. The method recited in claim 1 , wherein the at least one nock coupling end includes a tab member disposed proximate either or both of the first end and the second end.

claim.body: the tab member includes a cap end openably coupled to a hollow section, the hollow section including an aperture through which the cord resides; and the tab member is secured to the cord by a knot residing within the hollow section.
claim.claim-text: 5. The method recited in claim 4 , wherein: the tab member includes a cap end openably coupled to a hollow section, the hollow section including an aperture through which the cord resides; and the tab member is secured to the cord by a knot residing within the hollow section.

claim.body: only one portion of the cord passes through the aperture.
claim.claim-text: 6. The method recited in claim 4 , wherein only one portion of the cord passes through the aperture.

claim.body: the at least one nock coupling end includes a loop disposed proximate either or both of the first end and the second end.
claim.claim-text: 7. The method recited in claim 1 , wherein the at least one nock coupling end includes a loop disposed proximate either or both of the first end and the second end.

claim.body: the at least one nock coupling end includes a tab member disposed proximate the first end and a loop disposed proximate the second end.
claim.claim-text: 8. The method recited in claim 1 , wherein the at least one nock coupling end includes a tab member disposed proximate the first end and a loop disposed proximate the second end.

claim.body: the tab member includes a cap end openably coupled to a hollow section, the hollow section including an aperture through which the cord resides; and the tab member is secured to the cord by a knot residing within the hollow section.
claim.claim-text: 9. The method recited in claim 8 , wherein: the tab member includes a cap end openably coupled to a hollow section, the hollow section including an aperture through which the cord resides; and the tab member is secured to the cord by a knot residing within the hollow section.

claim.body: (i) the at least one nock coupling end comprises a first nock coupling end proximal the first end and a second nock coupling end proximal the second end, and (ii) the anchor point is operatively coupled to two portions along the longitudinal section of the cord.
claim.claim-text: 10. The method recited in claim 1 , wherein (i) the at least one nock coupling end comprises a first nock coupling end proximal the first end and a second nock coupling end proximal the second end, and (ii) the anchor point is operatively coupled to two portions along the longitudinal section of the cord.

claim.body: the anchor point comprises a hooking mechanism.
claim.claim-text: 11. The method recited in claim 1 , wherein the anchor point comprises a hooking mechanism.

claim.body: securing the portion of the longitudinal section to the quiver comprises securing the portion of the longitudinal section to a gripper assembly via a hole in the gripper assembly.
claim.claim-text: 13. The method recited in claim 12 , wherein said securing the portion of the longitudinal section to the quiver comprises securing the portion of the longitudinal section to a gripper assembly via a hole in the gripper assembly.

claim.body: securing the portion of the longitudinal section to the quiver comprises securing the portion of the longitudinal section to a body section of the quiver.
claim.claim-text: 14. The method recited in claim 12 , wherein said securing the portion of the longitudinal section to the quiver comprises securing the portion of the longitudinal section to a body section of the quiver.

claim.body: the at least one nock coupling end to the nock of the arrow includes passing a portion of the cord through the nock.
claim.claim-text: 15. The method recited in claim 12 , wherein said attaching the at least one nock coupling end to the nock of the arrow includes passing a portion of the cord through the nock.

claim.body: securing the portion of the longitudinal section includes securing the portion of the longitudinal section to a gripper assembly via first and second holes in the gripper assembly.
claim.claim-text: 17. The method recited in claim 16 , wherein said securing the portion of the longitudinal section includes securing the portion of the longitudinal section to a gripper assembly via first and second holes in the gripper assembly.

claim.body: securing the portion of the longitudinal section comprises securing the portion of the longitudinal section to at least one lace in a body section of the quiver.
claim.claim-text: 18. The method recited in claim 16 , wherein said securing the portion of the longitudinal section comprises securing the portion of the longitudinal section to at least one lace in a body section of the quiver.

claim.body: the at least one nock coupling end to the nock of the arrow in includes passing a portion of the cord through the nock.
claim.claim-text: 19. The method recited in claim 16 , wherein said attaching the at least one nock coupling end to the nock of the arrow in includes passing a portion of the cord through the nock.
